name: Business Entry Champions
title: Top Operational Efficiency in Business Entry
description: In 2024, Rwanda achieved a perfect score of 100 in the operational efficiency of business entry, showcasing its streamlined processes for new businesses.

name: Swift Justice
title: Leading Ease of Resolving Commercial Disputes
description: Rwanda scored an impressive 94.63 in 2024 for ease of resolving commercial disputes, reflecting its efficient legal framework.

name: Gender Parity Pioneers
title: Highest Proportion of Women in Parliament
description: With 63.75% of parliamentary seats held by women in 2024, Rwanda leads the world in gender representation.

name: Human Capital Builders
title: Strong Human Resources Development
description: Rwanda's commitment to building human resources is evident with a rating of 5 out of 6 in 2023, highlighting its focus on education and workforce development.

name: Environmental Stewards
title: High Environmental Sustainability Rating
description: In 2023, Rwanda scored 4.5 out of 6 for its policies and institutions supporting environmental sustainability, indicating a strong commitment to ecological preservation.

name: Revenue Mobilization Experts
title: Efficient Revenue Mobilization
description: Rwanda's efficiency in revenue mobilization is reflected in its 4.5 out of 6 rating in 2023, showcasing effective fiscal policies.

name: Social Inclusion Advocates
title: Strong Social Inclusion Policies
description: With a 4.4 out of 6 rating in 2023, Rwanda demonstrates robust policies for social inclusion and equity.

name: Public Administration Improvers
title: Quality Public Administration
description: Rwanda's public administration quality is rated at 4 out of 6 in 2023, indicating a well-functioning government system.

name: Dispute Resolution Experts
title: High Overall Dispute Resolution Score
description: Rwanda's overall score of 82.87 in 2024 for dispute resolution highlights its effective legal processes.

name: Health Challenge
title: Low Diarrhea Treatment Coverage
description: In 2020, only 19.3% of children under 5 in Rwanda received oral rehydration and continued feeding for diarrhea treatment, indicating a critical area for improvement.
